channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Activist Jolovan Wham apologises to Josephine Teo for false corruption claims; both men issued legal letters have apologised
item.description:
May 22, 2020 2:28 PM

SINGAPORE - Social worker and activist Jolovan Wham on Friday (May 22) apologised to Manpower Minister Josephine Teo for making false corruption allegations against her and has removed the statement he made on Facebook containing the accusations.

item.title: Coronavirus: Some Malaysians in limbo over their job status in Singapore
item.description:
May 22, 2020 1:00 PM

SINGAPORE (THE NEW PAPER) - Her husband remains in Singapore even though she has returned to Johor with their three-year-old son after the boy's social visit pass expired last month.

item.title: Dealer who sold car with tampered odometer wins case
item.description:
May 22, 2020 11:48 AM

SINGAPORE - A car buyer lost his case against a dealer for selling him a car which had clocked six times the mileage shown on its odometer - all because of a technicality.

item.title: CPF interest rates for July to September to remain unchanged
item.description:
May 22, 2020 11:34 AM

SINGAPORE - The interest rates that Central Provident Fund (CPF) members earn on their various accounts will remain unchanged in the third quarter, said the CPF Board and Housing Board on Friday (May 22).

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on May 22
item.description:
May 22, 2020 8:02 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Friday, May 22.

item.title: Coronavirus: New cluster at nursing home; 23rd fatality as male S'porean, 73, dies
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

A new Covid-19 cluster was identified at the Orange Valley Nursing Home branch in Simei after four of the home's residents tested positive for the coronavirus.

item.title: NLB, National Museum want photos, objects that reflect life during Covid-19
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

People and organisations can from today send in videos, photographs and journal entries that capture their lives during the Covid-19 pandemic, as part of the country's efforts to archive the everyday impact of the coronavirus on society.

item.title: First foreign worker patient to be moved to rehabilitative care
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's first foreign worker to be struck down by Covid-19 has, after more than three months in hospital, recovered sufficiently to be moved to a community hospital that focuses on rehabilitative care to recuperate.

item.title: More young people who run afoul of law placed on probation
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

More young people who run afoul of the law are being placed on probation, a rise due partly to the increase in the number of such arrests.

item.title: New free masks more comfortable, have better filtration
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore residents can collect new reusable masks from Tuesday, in a third mask distribution exercise that will span three weeks.

item.title: Law Society rolls out $1m Covid-19 relief package for members
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

First-time lawyers will not have to pay the fee of about $800 for their practising certificate as the Law Society is picking up the tab, as part of its relief support for the profession following the Covid-19 circuit breaker measures.

item.title: Can I travel to a park outside of my immediate neighbourhood, can I picnic at the beach after June 1?
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Restrictions on exercise, gatherings will still be in place after June 1.

item.title: Low-key graduation ceremonies for SAF specialist cadets
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Graduation parades have long been a prized feature of the Singapore Armed Forces (SAF) but Third Sergeant (3SG) Maisarah Abdul Raof and her squad mates had a low-key version instead because of the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Going back to school not optional; safety measures will be in place
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Attending school will not be optional, and students will have to return to school according to their assigned schedules from June 2.

item.title: Internet love scams up, but less money lost
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of Internet love scams increased in the first three months of the year, although the total amount of money stolen fell.

item.title: Perennial, Shun Tak donate 5m masks to vulnerable groups
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Perennial Real Estate Holdings has teamed up with Hong Kong-based Shun Tak Hold-ings to donate five million surgical masks to the National Council of Social Service (NCSS) in an effort to support vulnerable groups during the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Prices of fresh chicken likely to go up next week
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Fresh chicken prices in Singapore are expected to rise next week as suppliers deal with the rising costs of procuring from poultry farms in Malaysia.

item.title: Planes grounded by Covid-19 kept in tip-top shape at Changi
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

About 800 maintenance workers have stepped up work around the clock to ensure that the planes can take to the skies quickly when air travel picks up again.

item.title: Police deploy robots to patrol dorm, ensure safe distancing
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

The police are using robots to patrol a foreign workers' dormitory in the eastern part of Singapore to ensure that the premises are secure and the residents abide by safe distancing rules.

item.title: PUB: Water tanks, pumps must be maintained during circuit breaker
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

All building owners, management corporations and town councils must continue proper maintenance of all water storage tanks and water pumps during the circuit breaker period, national water agency PUB said in response to queries about the risk of Legionnaires' disease in Singapore.

item.title: No pruning down on essential upkeep of Singapore greenery
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

In a matter of weeks, they have sprouted by the roadside, next to canals and on beaches. Weeds and wildflowers have run rampant across Singapore where previously they were not allowed to bloom.

item.title: The long, long grass of home
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Weeds and wildflowers are growing across the island after the cutting of grass was scaled back during the circuit breaker period. But while some people welcome the proliferation of weeds, saying it could also lead to more wild bees and butterflies, others worry that the taller grass could be a breeding ground for mosquitoes.

item.title: Aidilfitri prayer calls will be on radio, online
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

The communal prayer calls for Hari Raya Aidilfitri and the special sermon on Sunday will not be broadcast on television because no religious content can be shown on free-to-air channels, the authorities said yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Should I wear a face mask or face shield?
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

People can choose to wear either a face mask or face shield when they leave the house, according to the Ministry of Health’s guidelines.

item.title: World passes 'tragic milestone' of 5m Covid-19 cases, says WHO
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Global coronavirus cases crossed the five million mark yesterday, creeping past 5.1 million last evening, just after the World Health Organisation (WHO) registered a daily record number - more than 106,000 - of new Covid-19 cases on Wednesday.

item.title: Boy, 6, hurt by concrete that fell from toilet ceiling in flat
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

A six-year-old boy was injured after being hit by concrete that fell from his Housing Board (HDB) flat's toilet ceiling due to wear and tear on Tuesday.

item.title: The cautious, uneasy easing of Covid-19 restrictions
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

As more countries relax their lockdown measures, the pressure mounts on others to follow suit.

item.title: Man apologises 'unreservedly' to Josephine Teo
item.description:
May 22, 2020 5:00 AM

One of the two men who accused Manpower Minister Josephine Teo and her husband of corruption has apologised and taken down the offending post, after receiving a letter of demand from her lawyers.

item.title: Preparing for a career in human resources at JCU
item.description:
May 22, 2020 4:00 AM

Learning about people management to meet business goals during his MBA studies helped Mr Jacob Chong to become an effective HR practitioner
